page.title: 06TRANSPORT THE HARBOUR
page.content: This is a safe harbour near to the Channel and accessible at all states of the tide. The yachts moor onto piles and there is room for 200 local pleasure boats,37 commercial craft,and 200 visitors. Also accomodated on mooring buoys are 70 West Wight Scows who race in the river and Solent.There is room ashore for 150 dinghies with 3 launching slipways. Facilities available are Customs clearance,3 boatyards and marine engineers,a sailmaker,a small crane,weather information and a nearby beach. A breakwater stops the waves. The stones of the breakwater come from the old London Bridge and the wood from the sleepers of the disused railway line.
